CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27, 1951, pg. 2, reads: "House Collapses - When this house at 119 Crawford Street began to crumble a brick at a time last week, twelve families who occupied it were ordered to move as well as resident of the house next door to it. Early last Thursday morning the entire rear wall gave way.  The city has since torn down the rest of the structure. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Three-story brick building with collapsed floor and rear wall, fire escape on side, and building inscribed "1506" on right, 119 Crawford Street, Hill District
